page.description: The UX Component is one of the basic building blocks for Alpha Anywhere applications. It is generally the main component for creating mobile apps.

section.description: There are a couple ways to locate the UX Component Builder in Alpha Anywhere

section.title: Finding the UX Builder using the "Create" menu

step.description: If you have set up Web Security already, Go to the Web Projects Control Panel and click in the Create dropdown list.
From the list choose the UX Component option. The Select UX Component Dialog will then open..

section.title: Finding the UX Builder through the "New" menu

step.description: Alternatively, click New on the Web Projects Control Panel toolbar.
In the New File Dialog select Web Component and click Next > .
When prompted for what type file you want to create, click UX and Next > .

The Select UX Component Dialog will load. Choose whether you want to work from a template or start with blank Grid Component and click OK. The UX Builder will then appear. The available template options are described in the following section.

sections.section: When you create a new UX component you have the option of either creating a completely new blank component or using a pre-existing template. This provides a structure to which additional controls additional controls can be added and existing ones can be customized to your liking. section.description: The UX Builder contains the following tools on it's toolbar.

item.name: [Save_button]
item.description: *[Save]*. Saves the currently open grid.

item.name: [Save_As_button]
item.description: *[Save As]*. Saves the currently open grid after asking for the path and filename.

item.name: [Insert_Code_button]
item.description: *[Save Page]*. Creates a temporary file that contains the grid, optionally opening the page in the HTML Editor.

item.name: [Load_button_2]
item.description: *[Open]*. Allows you to select and open an existing grid from any of your projects.

item.name: [New_Query_button]
item.description: *[New]*. Allows you to create a new grid.

item.name: [Preview_Button_2]
item.description: *[Browser]*. Displays the grid component in a temporary page in your browser of choice.

item.name: [WPT_Grid_BlueLightning]
item.description: *[Remote Test]*. Test on a remote device (such as a phone or tablet)

item.name: [Publish_button]
item.description: *[Publish]*. Publishes the grid to the destination associated with the selected profile.

item.name: [Control_Panel_button]
item.description: *[WebÂ Projects]*. Displays the Web Projects Control Panel.

item.name: [A_SQL]
item.description: *[SQL]*. Loads the SQL Tools menu.

item.name: [A_Abutton]
item.description: *[Web Style Builder]*. Opens the Web Style Builder

item.name: [A_Server]
item.description: *[Server]*. Turn the server on and off, when on the server icon appears green.

item.name: [Close_button_2]
item.description: *[Close]*. Closes the Grid Builder.

section.description: The page menu lets you select the different UX builder pages that allow you to construct a UX component.
Page options are listed below. When you first open the UX Builder the page menu will appear like this:

item.name: Overview
item.description: A basic intro page that describes the UX Component and how to get started.

item.name: [UX > Controls]
item.description: Specifies the controls and control properties that will appear in the UX.

item.name: [UX > Properties]
item.description: Specifies properties for the UX component.

item.name: [UX > Data Binding]
item.description: Bind UX controls with new or existing tables.

item.name: [Events > Server-side]
item.description: Allows you to set server-side events

item.name: [Events > Client-side]
item.description: Allows you to set Client-side events

item.name: [Code > Javascript functions]
item.description: Allows you to add javascript to a UX, edit javascript functions, and add javascript actions.

item.name: Code > Xbasic functions
item.description: Allows you to add and manipulate Xbasic function

item.name: Information
item.description: Allows you to record information about the UX.
